That's not quite the issue. :] 

The larger issue we run into is his animations, and the tech that would likely need to be created to make it happen. 

For example, if he's no longer goo, and let's say, water, Snowman Zac, like you'd suggested, we'd likely want him to move a bit differently than goo. 

Many have suggested a Gentleman Zac skin, and I think it'd be adorable, however, since he stretches, it becomes fairly difficult to give him clothing that won't look crazy or, well, bad, for lack of a better term.

These aren't excuses, but merely the kinds of things we discuss and figure out solutions to so we can come out with a really cool Zac skin that's more than him in another color.

so as for the gentleman zac skin idea all you would need to do is design a splash with jinx painting a tuxedo on zac.
that then gives you more room to work as well as applying the properties of paint to zac. so that when he's small the tux is fine
but when he gets past a set hp/size the tux takes on the properties of paint and starts to show cracks in it as it expands.
for the goo that zac drops you can leave it the same. as zac would want to keep his core section were the paint is from cracking. this will also give him the look like he's much more scary when he's full hp. you could give him a top hat, but then you would need to give the top hat its own animation model as well as its sitting position on zac's head. small zac hat covers his head. medium zac, hat fits fine. big zac hat is to small.
what I have just said is still a lot of work especially if riot (which I know they do) wants to make it look good.
